cities.name: Haapsalu

Art & Culture.name: Haapsalu Castle and Cathedral
Art & Culture.description: Medieval castle ruins with a well-preserved cathedral and scenic towers. Don‚Äôt miss the legend of the White Lady ‚Äî said to appear in the church window every August.

Art & Culture.name: Ilon‚Äôs Wonderland (Iloni Imedemaa)
Art & Culture.description: Charming interactive museum celebrating illustrator Ilon Wikland, who created the art for Astrid Lindgren‚Äôs books like Pippi Longstocking and Karlsson-on-the-Roof.

Art & Culture.name: Haapsalu Railway Museum
Art & Culture.description: Historic train station turned museum, featuring vintage locomotives and carriages ‚Äî including the one used by the Tsar‚Äôs family.

Art & Culture.name: Haapsalu Cultural Center
Art & Culture.description: Hosts concerts, theatre, and film events ‚Äî a hub for local and international cultural life.

Art & Culture.name: Haapsalu Lace Center
Art & Culture.description: Learn about Haapsalu‚Äôs world-famous handmade lace tradition ‚Äî delicate craftsmanship passed down through generations.

Photo Spots.name: Haapsalu Promenade
Photo Spots.description: Picturesque wooden walkway along the bay, with pavilions, swans, and romantic sea views.

Photo Spots.name: Africa Beach Pavilion
Photo Spots.description: Iconic 19th-century wooden pavilion once visited by Russian nobility ‚Äî now a perfect sunset photo spot.

Photo Spots.name: Haapsalu Castle Tower
Photo Spots.description: Climb the tower for sweeping views of the Old Town rooftops and shimmering Haapsalu Bay.

Photo Spots.name: Tchaikovsky‚Äôs Bench
Photo Spots.description: A peaceful seaside bench honoring the composer, who once spent summers composing music here.

Food & Nightlife.name: Hapsal Dietrich
Food & Nightlife.description: Elegant restaurant blending Estonian and European cuisine with cozy vintage decor.

Food & Nightlife.name: Wiigi Caf√©
Food & Nightlife.description: Seaside caf√© serving local fish dishes, cakes, and coffee ‚Äî great for relaxing after a walk.

Food & Nightlife.name: Vegetarian Resto Beguta
Food & Nightlife.description: Colorful vegetarian restaurant known for fresh local ingredients and creative plates.

Food & Nightlife.name: Kuursaal
Food & Nightlife.description: Historic wooden seaside concert hall and restaurant ‚Äî a cultural icon of Haapsalu‚Äôs spa era.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Haapsalu Promenade
Nature & Relaxation.description: Relaxing coastal walk with sea breeze, sculptures, and wooden gazebos from the 19th century.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Paralepa Beach
Nature & Relaxation.description: One of Estonia‚Äôs warmest beaches, sheltered by pine forest ‚Äî ideal for swimming and picnics.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Ungru Manor Ruins
Nature & Relaxation.description: Hauntingly beautiful ruins of a neo-Gothic manor, surrounded by nature and legends.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Birdwatching at Haapsalu Bay
Nature & Relaxation.description: Popular birding area with observation towers ‚Äî especially active during spring migration.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Haapsalu-style smoked fish, local rye bread, and rhubarb desserts. Estonian craft beers and juniper lemonade are popular local drinks.

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start your day with coffee at Wiigi Caf√©, then visit Haapsalu Castle to learn about the town‚Äôs medieval legends.
full_day.afternoon: üé® Explore Ilon‚Äôs Wonderland and Lace Center, then walk the Promenade for sea views.
full_day.evening: üåá Enjoy dinner at Hapsal Dietrich or the historic Kuursaal restaurant.
full_day.night: üåô Watch the sunset from Africa Beach Pavilion or stroll by Tchaikovsky‚Äôs Bench under the stars.

spring.highlight: Birdsong, blossoms, and calm seaside walks welcome the start of the warm season.

ideas.name: Birdwatching at Haapsalu Bay
ideas.description: Thousands of migrating birds stop here ‚Äî a paradise for nature lovers.

ideas.name: Stroll the Promenade
ideas.description: Early blooms and sea breeze make springtime walks especially peaceful.

summer.highlight: Haapsalu comes alive with festivals, beach days, and outdoor caf√©s.

ideas.name: Haapsalu Tchaikovsky Festival
ideas.description: Celebrates the composer‚Äôs connection to Haapsalu with concerts and classical performances.

ideas.name: Swimming at Paralepa Beach
ideas.description: Enjoy the warm, shallow waters and pine-scented air.

autumn.highlight: Golden leaves, quiet streets, and cozy caf√©s create a peaceful retreat.

ideas.name: Visit the Castle Museum
ideas.description: Cool weather makes exploring the medieval ruins more atmospheric.

ideas.name: Taste Autumn Flavors at Hapsal Dietrich
ideas.description: Try seasonal dishes like mushroom soup and apple desserts.

winter.highlight: Quiet charm, frozen sea views, and warm lights from cozy caf√©s.

ideas.name: Winter Walk by the Bay
ideas.description: The frozen promenade feels like a fairy-tale landscape.

ideas.name: Christmas Market at the Castle
ideas.description: Local crafts, music, and festive treats inside the historic courtyard.

public_transport_tips.tip: Haapsalu is reachable by bus from Tallinn in about 1.5 hours ‚Äî main routes are operated by Lux Express and local carriers.
The town is compact and walkable, with bike rentals available near the promenade and bus station.
During summer, tourist trains connect Haapsalu‚Äôs main sights like the castle and the beach.

city_events.description: Tchaikovsky Festival ‚Äî open-air concerts and classical performances celebrating the composer‚Äôs link to Haapsalu.
White Lady Festival ‚Äî a cultural event based on Haapsalu‚Äôs famous ghost legend, featuring theatre and music inside the castle.
Cozy Christmas market with local crafts and festive lights around the castle and promenade.

places.name: Haapsalu Castle
places.description: Historic fortress with panoramic towers, a medieval museum, and Estonia‚Äôs most famous ghost story.

places.name: Ilon‚Äôs Wonderland
places.description: Interactive children‚Äôs museum dedicated to the illustrator of Pippi Longstocking ‚Äî full of color and imagination.

places.name: Paralepa Beach
places.description: A peaceful sandy beach surrounded by pine trees ‚Äî great for swimming or relaxing.

hidden_gems.name: Ungru Manor Ruins
hidden_gems.description: Fairy-tale ruins of a grand neo-Gothic manor hidden near the airport.

hidden_gems.name: Haapsalu Episcopal Castle Moat Path
hidden_gems.description: Quiet trail circling the castle ‚Äî beautiful reflections in the water during sunrise.

hidden_gems.name: Kongo Hotel Rooftop View
hidden_gems.description: Small hidden terrace offering panoramic views over the red rooftops of the Old Town.

cities.name: Narva

Art & Culture.name: Narva Castle (Hermann Castle)
Art & Culture.description: Impressive medieval fortress overlooking the Narva River, directly across from Russia‚Äôs Ivangorod Castle ‚Äî a symbol of the city‚Äôs dramatic history.

Art & Culture.name: Narva Art Gallery
Art & Culture.description: Located inside Narva Castle, featuring rotating exhibitions of Estonian and Baltic art.

Art & Culture.name: Narva Town Hall
Art & Culture.description: Rebuilt 17th-century Baroque town hall, reflecting Narva‚Äôs days as a key Swedish and Hanseatic trading city.

Art & Culture.name: Kreenholm Textile Factory
Art & Culture.description: A massive 19th-century industrial complex once employing over 10,000 workers ‚Äî now a hauntingly beautiful site for tours and cultural events.

Art & Culture.name: Narva Bastions
Art & Culture.description: Historic fortifications surrounding the old town, offering walking paths and river views.

Photo Spots.name: Narva Castle Tower View
Photo Spots.description: Climb the castle tower for a dramatic panorama of Narva River and Ivangorod Castle across the border.

Photo Spots.name: Friendship Bridge
Photo Spots.description: The symbolic bridge connecting Estonia and Russia ‚Äî capturing both sides of history in one shot.

Photo Spots.name: Kreenholm Industrial Area
Photo Spots.description: Massive red-brick factory complex with cathedral-like architecture ‚Äî an urban photographer‚Äôs dream.

Photo Spots.name: Narva River Promenade
Photo Spots.description: Modern riverside walkway with fountains, sculptures, and views of both Estonian and Russian castles.

Food & Nightlife.name: Rondeel Restaurant
Food & Nightlife.description: Elegant restaurant located inside Narva Castle ‚Äî serving Baltic cuisine with local ingredients and historic ambiance.

Food & Nightlife.name: Old Trafford Pub
Food & Nightlife.description: Friendly local pub with hearty food, sports on TV, and occasional live music.

Food & Nightlife.name: Muna Caf√©
Food & Nightlife.description: Trendy caf√© with great coffee, pastries, and a mix of Estonian and international dishes ‚Äî a popular student hangout.

Food & Nightlife.name: Sport Bar Tartu 2024
Food & Nightlife.description: Modern sports bar with good burgers and an easygoing atmosphere near the river promenade.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Narva River Promenade
Nature & Relaxation.description: Perfect for walks along the water, with benches, caf√©s, and evening lights reflecting on the river.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Dark Garden (Pimeaed)
Nature & Relaxation.description: A peaceful park near the castle ‚Äî once a private garden, now a local favorite for picnics and quiet reading.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Kreenholm Island
Nature & Relaxation.description: Natural island in the Narva River surrounded by waterfalls and historical industrial ruins.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Narva-J√µesuu Beach
Nature & Relaxation.description: Just 15 minutes away ‚Äî one of Estonia‚Äôs best sandy beaches, nicknamed the 'Pearl of the Baltic Sea'.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Estonian-Russian fusion dishes like pelmeni, smoked fish, and beetroot soup. Narva‚Äôs caf√©s also serve excellent pastries and local beers.

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start with breakfast at Muna Caf√©, then explore Narva Castle and its riverside fortifications.
full_day.afternoon: üè≠ Take a guided tour of the Kreenholm Factory and have lunch at Rondeel Restaurant.
full_day.evening: üåá Walk the Narva Promenade for sunset views across the border.
full_day.night: üåô Grab dinner or drinks at Old Trafford Pub and enjoy the city‚Äôs calm nighttime vibe.

spring.highlight: Fresh green parks and the rushing river make Narva come alive after winter.

ideas.name: Promenade Walk
ideas.description: Flowers bloom and locals return to the riverbanks.

ideas.name: Castle Garden Picnic
ideas.description: Relax in the castle park surrounded by history and spring air.

summer.highlight: Warm days, music festivals, and outdoor caf√©s by the river.

ideas.name: Narva-J√µesuu Beach Day
ideas.description: Swim, sunbathe, or enjoy an ice cream by the Baltic Sea.

ideas.name: Narva River Promenade Festival
ideas.description: Outdoor concerts, crafts, and local food near the fortress walls.

autumn.highlight: Golden leaves and mist over the river create a mysterious beauty.

ideas.name: Kreenholm Photography Walk
ideas.description: Capture autumn light and industrial heritage among red-brick walls.

ideas.name: Warm Drinks at Muna Caf√©
ideas.description: Enjoy coffee and pastries while the city slows down for autumn.

winter.highlight: Snow-covered castle walls and icy river scenes turn Narva into a winter fairytale.

ideas.name: Winter Lights at Narva Castle
ideas.description: The illuminated fortress looks magical in the snow.

ideas.name: Christmas Market
ideas.description: Festive stalls and lights brighten the historic square.

public_transport_tips.tip: Narva is easily reached by train from Tallinn in about 2.5 hours ‚Äî comfortable and scenic along the Estonian countryside.
Local buses connect the train station, castle area, and Kreenholm district.
For a beach trip, buses run frequently between Narva and Narva-J√µesuu.

city_events.description: Narva Opera Days ‚Äî open-air performances inside Narva Castle courtyard.
Station Narva ‚Äî a music and urban culture festival bringing together artists from Estonia and beyond.
Christmas Market ‚Äî cozy winter event near Town Hall with lights, crafts, and local treats.

places.name: Narva Castle
places.description: Historic fortress with towers, museum exhibitions, and views over the Narva River and Russia.

places.name: Kreenholm Factory
places.description: Monumental industrial complex that shaped Narva‚Äôs history ‚Äî now used for cultural events.

places.name: Narva-J√µesuu Beach
places.description: Estonia‚Äôs northernmost beach town, with fine sand and seaside charm.

hidden_gems.name: Dark Garden (Pimeaed)
hidden_gems.description: Quiet park hidden behind the castle ‚Äî ideal for reflection or sketching the river view.

hidden_gems.name: Narva College (University of Tartu)
hidden_gems.description: Architectural masterpiece blending old and new ‚Äî a modern landmark in the heart of Narva.

hidden_gems.name: Victoria Bastion Tunnels
hidden_gems.description: Underground tunnels from the 17th century ‚Äî explore with a guide for a glimpse into Narva‚Äôs military past.

cities.name: P√§rnu

Art & Culture.name: P√§rnu Museum
Art & Culture.description: Modern museum tracing the city‚Äôs history from medieval times to its golden era as Estonia‚Äôs summer capital.

Art & Culture.name: Red Tower (Punane Torn)
Art & Culture.description: The oldest building in P√§rnu ‚Äî a medieval prison tower now used for exhibitions and 360¬∞ digital history shows.

Art & Culture.name: P√§rnu Town Gallery
Art & Culture.description: Exhibition space for contemporary Estonian artists, located in a charming old town setting.

Art & Culture.name: St. Elizabeth‚Äôs Church
Art & Culture.description: Beautiful baroque church with excellent acoustics and summer organ concerts.

Art & Culture.name: Sculpture of the Mermaid

Photo Spots.description: Colorful houses, cozy caf√©s, and cobblestone lanes perfect for charming photos.

Photo Spots.name: Tallinna Gate
Photo Spots.description: Historic 17th-century gate once welcoming visitors to the city ‚Äî now a picturesque landmark.

Photo Spots.name: P√§rnu Pier (Mole)
Photo Spots.description: Long stone pier stretching into the sea ‚Äî a favorite place for romantic walks and ocean views.

Food & Nightlife.name: Supelsaksad Caf√©
Food & Nightlife.description: Vintage-style caf√© known for homemade cakes, warm service, and cozy seaside garden.

Food & Nightlife.name: Edelweiss
Food & Nightlife.description: Charming German-style restaurant serving hearty dishes and local beer in a timbered house.

Food & Nightlife.name: Steffani Pizza
Food & Nightlife.description: Local legend for pizza and pasta ‚Äî colorful interior, friendly staff, and open until late.

Food & Nightlife.name: P√§rnu Beach Bar
Food & Nightlife.description: Lively beachfront bar with music, cocktails, and summer parties as the sun sets.

Nature & Relaxation.name: P√§rnu Beach
Nature & Relaxation.description: Wide sandy beach famous for warm shallow water and a lively summer vibe ‚Äî ideal for swimming and volleyball.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Vallik√§√§r Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Beautiful riverside park with fountains, bridges, and evening light shows in summer.

Nature & Relaxation.name: P√§rnu River Promenade
Nature & Relaxation.description: Calm walking route with great views and benches to enjoy the sea breeze.

Nature & Relaxation.name: P√§rnu Beach Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Shady green park beside the sea ‚Äî perfect for picnics and reading under the trees.

cities.local_food_tip: Try local smoked fish, creamy Estonian potato salad, and Kama dessert. Don‚Äôt miss ice cream from seaside kiosks during summer evenings.

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Have breakfast at Supelsaksad Caf√©, then stroll along the Beach Promenade.
full_day.afternoon: üèñÔ∏è Spend time relaxing on P√§rnu Beach, then visit the P√§rnu Museum to learn about local history.
full_day.evening: üåá Walk to the P√§rnu Pier for sunset, followed by dinner at Edelweiss or Steffani Pizza.
full_day.night: üåô End your day with a drink or live music at P√§rnu Beach Bar.

spring.highlight: The city wakes up with flowers, seaside walks, and outdoor caf√©s reopening.

ideas.name: Park Walks in Vallik√§√§r
ideas.description: Enjoy blooming trees and colorful spring fountains.

ideas.name: Bike Along the River Promenade
ideas.description: Cycle along quiet riverbanks with gentle sea breeze.

summer.highlight: P√§rnu becomes Estonia‚Äôs summer capital ‚Äî full of festivals, beach parties, and sunshine.

ideas.name: P√§rnu Beach Days
ideas.description: Swimming, paddleboarding, volleyball, and endless sunshine.

ideas.name: Weekend Festival Baltic
ideas.description: Massive electronic music festival right on the beach.

autumn.highlight: Golden parks, cozy caf√©s, and calm sea winds make for a relaxing season.

ideas.name: Old Town Walks
ideas.description: Explore colorful facades and autumn leaves along cobblestone streets.

ideas.name: Spa Day at Hedon Spa
ideas.description: Warm pools and sea views ‚Äî perfect for a chilly afternoon.

winter.highlight: Peaceful seaside town atmosphere and cozy spa retreats.

ideas.name: P√§rnu Christmas Market
ideas.description: Festive lights, mulled wine, and local crafts in the old town.

ideas.name: Hot Sauna Experience
ideas.description: Warm up with Estonian sauna traditions after a snowy beach walk.

public_transport_tips.tip: Buses connect P√§rnu with Tallinn and Tartu several times daily ‚Äî the main terminal is near the city center.
Local buses and electric scooters are great for short-distance travel between the beach and downtown.
P√§rnu is flat and bike-friendly ‚Äî renting a bike is perfect for exploring the parks and promenade.

city_events.description: Weekend Festival Baltic ‚Äî one of Northern Europe‚Äôs biggest electronic music festivals held on P√§rnu Beach.
P√§rnu International Documentary and Anthropology Film Festival ‚Äî celebrating culture and storytelling through film.
P√§rnu Christmas Market ‚Äî cozy stalls, lights, and hot drinks by the Town Hall Square.

places.name: P√§rnu Beach
places.description: Estonia‚Äôs most famous beach ‚Äî wide, shallow, and full of summer energy.

places.name: P√§rnu Museum
places.description: Discover the story of P√§rnu from medieval fort to modern spa town.

places.name: Tallinna Gate
places.description: Historic gateway that once guarded the city ‚Äî now a quiet, scenic landmark.

hidden_gems.name: P√§rnu Vallik√§√§r Tunnels
hidden_gems.description: Small historic tunnels hidden under the park ‚Äî fun to explore during festivals or guided tours.

hidden_gems.name: Rannahotell Terrace
hidden_gems.description: Stylish 1930s hotel with a seaside terrace perfect for coffee and panoramic views.

hidden_gems.name: Endla Theatre Rooftop
hidden_gems.description: Hidden rooftop terrace occasionally open during performances ‚Äî offering city and sea views.

cities.name: Tartu

Art & Culture.name: University of Tartu
Art & Culture.description: Founded in 1632, this is Estonia‚Äôs oldest university and a symbol of Tartu‚Äôs intellectual spirit. Visit the main building‚Äôs grand hall and student prison beneath it!

Art & Culture.name: Tartu Art Museum
Art & Culture.description: Known as 'the Leaning House of Tartu' for its tilted facade, this museum showcases modern Estonian and Baltic art in a charming old town building.

Art & Culture.name: AHHAA Science Centre
Art & Culture.description: Interactive science center with hands-on experiments, a planetarium, and live lab shows ‚Äî perfect for curious minds of all ages.

Art & Culture.name: Estonian National Museum (ERM)
Art & Culture.description: Massive modern museum that tells the story of Estonian culture and identity, with exhibits on folk traditions, languages, and modern life.

Art & Culture.name: Supilinn District
Art & Culture.description: Known as the 'Soup Town,' this colorful wooden neighborhood near the river is full of street art, quirky houses, and bohemian caf√©s.

Photo Spots.name: Town Hall Square (Raekoja plats)
Photo Spots.description: The heart of Tartu with its famous Kissing Students Fountain, surrounded by pastel-colored buildings and lively caf√©s.

Photo Spots.name: Angel‚Äôs Bridge (Inglisild)
Photo Spots.description: Historic bridge in Toome Hill Park ‚Äî locals say crossing it makes you wiser!

Photo Spots.name: Toome Hill Park
Photo Spots.description: Scenic park with university ruins, viewpoints, and winding paths ‚Äî one of Tartu‚Äôs most photogenic spots.

Photo Spots.name: River Emaj√µgi Embankment
Photo Spots.description: Peaceful riverwalk offering sunset reflections, rowing boats, and cozy caf√©s along the banks.

Food & Nightlife.name: Werner Caf√©
Food & Nightlife.description: Historic caf√© known for its desserts and elegant interior ‚Äî a long-time student favorite since 1895.

Food & Nightlife.name: Restoran Antonius
Food & Nightlife.description: Fine dining restaurant in a romantic vaulted cellar serving modern Estonian cuisine.

Food & Nightlife.name: Barlova
Food & Nightlife.description: Trendy bohemian bar in the Supilinn district ‚Äî known for craft beer, music, and creative locals.

Food & Nightlife.name: Gunpowder Cellar (P√ºssirohukelder)
Food & Nightlife.description: A legendary restaurant and pub inside a 300-year-old gunpowder cellar ‚Äî Guinness World Record holder for the world‚Äôs highest pub ceiling.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Toome Hill Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Leafy park filled with sculptures, university ruins, and peaceful walking paths above the city.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Emaj√µgi River Cruise
Nature & Relaxation.description: Take a relaxing boat ride through the heart of Tartu ‚Äî great for photos and sunset views.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Botanical Garden of Tartu
Nature & Relaxation.description: Estonia‚Äôs oldest botanical garden, with tropical greenhouses, koi ponds, and peaceful paths near the Old Town.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Anne Canal Beach
Nature & Relaxation.description: Popular local swimming area with playgrounds, caf√©s, and volleyball courts in summer.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Estonian classics like kama dessert, rye bread, and smoked fish. Don‚Äôt miss a slice of cake at Werner Caf√© or a hearty meal at P√ºssirohukelder!

full_day.morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start with breakfast at Werner Caf√©, then stroll to University of Tartu and Toome Hill for beautiful views.
full_day.afternoon: üéì Visit the Estonian National Museum or the AHHAA Science Centre. Have lunch near Town Hall Square.
full_day.evening: üåá Walk along the Emaj√µgi River and explore Supilinn‚Äôs cozy caf√©s.
full_day.night: üåô Dine at P√ºssirohukelder or enjoy live music at Barlova.

spring.highlight: Tartu bursts into bloom with festivals, outdoor caf√©s, and students celebrating 'Spring Days.'

ideas.name: University Spring Days Festival
ideas.description: Student parades, concerts, and fun competitions take over the city.

ideas.name: Botanical Garden Blossoms
ideas.description: See colorful spring flowers along the river.

summer.highlight: Warm, lively city atmosphere with open-air concerts, river festivals, and long daylight hours.

ideas.name: Emaj√µgi River Festival
ideas.description: Music, lights, and food along the riverside promenade.

ideas.name: Outdoor Cinema Nights
ideas.description: Watch movies under the stars in the parks or near the Town Hall.

autumn.highlight: Golden trees and student energy fill the city as university life returns.

ideas.name: Toome Hill Walks
ideas.description: Perfect for leaf photography and quiet moments.

ideas.name: Caf√© Hopping in Supilinn
ideas.description: Warm drinks and cozy art spaces as the weather cools.

winter.highlight: Snow-covered rooftops, glowing lights, and a festive atmosphere make Tartu magical.

ideas.name: Tartu Christmas Village
ideas.description: Town Hall Square transforms into a winter wonderland.

ideas.name: AHHAA Science Centre Indoor Fun
ideas.description: Warm up with science experiments and planetarium shows.

public_transport_tips.tip: Tartu is 2 hours from Tallinn by frequent trains or Lux Express buses.
Local buses run efficiently around the city ‚Äî buy tickets via the Tartu Smart City app or at stops.
Tartu is flat and very walkable ‚Äî renting a bike or e-scooter is a fun way to explore.

city_events.description: Tartu Student Spring Days ‚Äî the biggest student festival in Estonia.
Hanisa Festival ‚Äî concerts, art, and cultural performances across the city.
Tartu Christmas Village ‚Äî festive lights, ice rink, and local food stalls.

places.name: Estonian National Museum (ERM)
places.description: A must-visit museum offering interactive exhibitions on Estonian culture and history.

places.name: AHHAA Science Centre
places.description: Fun and educational experience full of hands-on science exhibits.

places.name: Town Hall Square
places.description: Lively square with the famous Kissing Students Fountain ‚Äî a perfect meeting spot.

hidden_gems.name: Soup Town (Supilinn)
hidden_gems.description: A bohemian district with colorful wooden houses and artistic street murals.

hidden_gems.name: Gunpowder Cellar Secret Tunnel
hidden_gems.description: A hidden passage under the old fortress connecting to one of Tartu‚Äôs oldest pubs.

hidden_gems.name: Karlova District

cities.name: Tallinn

Art & Culture.name: Tallinn Old Town
Art & Culture.description: UNESCO World Heritage-listed medieval old town, full of cobblestone streets, Gothic churches, and colorful merchant houses. A living postcard of Northern Europe‚Äôs Hanseatic past.

Art & Culture.name: Kumu Art Museum
Art & Culture.description: Estonia‚Äôs largest art museum, blending classic and modern works in a striking contemporary building surrounded by Kadriorg Park.

Art & Culture.name: Kadriorg Palace
Art & Culture.description: Built by Peter the Great for Catherine I, this Baroque palace is now home to the foreign art collection of the Estonian Art Museum.

Art & Culture.name: Seaplane Harbour Museum (Lennusadam)
Art & Culture.description: Award-winning maritime museum inside a giant seaplane hangar, featuring submarines, ships, and flight simulators.

Art & Culture.name: Telliskivi Creative City
Art & Culture.description: Trendy district filled with murals, design shops, art galleries, and indie restaurants ‚Äî the heart of Tallinn‚Äôs creative energy.

Photo Spots.name: Kohtuotsa Viewing Platform
Photo Spots.description: Panoramic viewpoint over Tallinn‚Äôs red rooftops and church spires ‚Äî the city‚Äôs most famous photo spot.

Photo Spots.name: Patkuli Stairs
Photo Spots.description: Classic view of the Old Town walls and Toompea Hill ‚Äî especially magical at sunset.

Photo Spots.name: Rotermann Quarter
Photo Spots.description: Striking mix of industrial heritage and modern architecture ‚Äî perfect for urban photography.

Photo Spots.name: Kadriorg Park
Photo Spots.description: Beautiful gardens and ponds around the palace ‚Äî vibrant in spring and autumn colors.

Food & Nightlife.name: III Draakon
Food & Nightlife.description: Medieval tavern inside the Town Hall building ‚Äî candles, elk soup, and a lively atmosphere straight out of the 15th century.

Food & Nightlife.name: Rataskaevu 16
Food & Nightlife.description: Charming local-favorite restaurant serving Estonian comfort dishes with a warm, rustic vibe.

Food & Nightlife.name: Pegasus
Food & Nightlife.description: Stylish modern restaurant with big windows overlooking the Town Hall Square ‚Äî perfect for evening dining.

Food & Nightlife.name: Telliskivi Brewery
Food & Nightlife.description: Trendy spot in the creative district with craft beers, live DJs, and a youthful crowd.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Kadriorg Park
Nature & Relaxation.description: Elegant park with fountains, ponds, and flower beds ‚Äî perfect for a peaceful stroll or picnic.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Stroomi Beach

cities.local_food_tip: Try Estonian black bread, herring, kama dessert, and local craft beers. Tallinn‚Äôs caf√©s serve great cinnamon buns and handmade chocolates!

public_transport_tips.tip: Tallinn‚Äôs trams, buses, and trolleys are managed by Tallinn Transport ‚Äî buy tickets via the pilet.ee app or with a contactless card.
From the airport to city center, tram line 4 takes only 15 minutes.
Walking or e-scooters are great for exploring the compact Old Town and nearby areas like Rotermann and Telliskivi.

city_events.description: Tallinn Maritime Days ‚Äî boat shows, concerts, and seaside fun in the harbor districts.
Tallinn Design Festival ‚Äî exhibitions, talks, and creative workshops across the city.
Tallinn Christmas Market ‚Äî one of Europe‚Äôs coziest winter fairs, dating back to 1441.
